intro: Pseudognaphalium cabrerae, commonly known as the Mexican everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pink ray florets, giving it a delicate appearance. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Pseudognaphalium cabrerae is known for its long-lasting blooms and is sometimes used in floral arrangements.
